meanings.definition: The quality or state of being voracious.
meanings.sent1: Her voracities for knowledge led her to read every book in the library.
meanings.sent2: The voracities of the lion were evident as it devoured its prey in seconds.
meanings.sent3: The voracities of the toddler for cookies always made his parents smile.
meanings.sent4: His voracities for adventure were like a hungry beast that could never be satisfied.
meanings.sent5: The voracities of the storm left a path of destruction in its wake.

meanings.sent1: The voracities of his appetite were legendary among his friends.
meanings.sent2: Witnessing the voracities of the competitive eater was both impressive and alarming.
meanings.sent3: The voracities of the squirrel raiding the bird feeder provided endless entertainment.
meanings.sent4: The voracities of time seemed to accelerate as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent5: The voracities of the market left investors scrambling to keep up.
